thread.title: Robin Tick

author: Robin Tick
title: Robin Tick
text:
Keepkey is a stylish device with smart user-friendly security features.
It features the largest display of any current hardware wallet, the display makes it easy to read text and Bitcoin addresses and even displays a tiny but functional QR code on the device for receving funds.
The address and QR code are also displayed on your computer but those might be modified by malware, that is why you want a hardware wallet in the first place.
This is one of the smart security features that means you have the security of trusting the device's display, with the convenience of scanning a QR code that you can trust.
Anything you type on your computer to interact with the device is scrambled so keylogging is useless.
The device autocompletes the words of your seed phrase after you type the first few scrambled letters so keylogging will not even tell the logger the length of your seed words, smart !
Entering both the pin and seed phrase uses a randomised number and letter position displayed on the screen of the Keepkey, I believe entering your seed phrase this way is safer than the way even Trezor does it.
The accompanying software is a Chrome extension, so you could hook this up to any PC Mac or Chromebook and use it.
The software features are not exhaustive but they are user friendly, you cannot choose a payment fee.
Because it's considered an advanced feature I had to contact support to find out how to setup an encrypted wallet seed, Keepkey has an interesting way of setting this up and once I knew how it was easy and quick, and most importantly secure !
I would recommend Keepkey to anyone looking for a user-friendly and good looking hardware wallet.
